info.title: ORSCF VisitData-API
info.description: NOTE: This is not intended be a 'RESTful' api, as it is NOT located on the persistence layer and is therefore NOT focused on doing CRUD operations! This HTTP-based API uses a 'call-based' approach to known BL operations. IN-, OUT- and return-arguments are transmitted using request-/response- wrappers (see [UJMW](https://github.com/KornSW/UnifiedJsonMessageWrapper)), which are very lightweight and are a compromise for broad support and adaptability in REST-inspired technologies as well as soap-inspired technologies!

post.summary: returns a list of API-features (there are several 'services' for different use cases, described by ORSCF) supported by this implementation. The following values are possible: 'VdrEventSubscription', 'VisitConsume', 'VisitSubmission', 'VisitHL7Export', 'VisitHL7Import', 'DataRecordingSubmission'

requestBody.description: request capsule containing the method arguments

post.summary: returns a list of available capabilities ("API:VisitDataConsume") and/or data-scopes ("Study:9B2C3F48-2941-2F8F-4D35-7D117D5C6F72") which are permitted for the CURRENT ACCESSOR and gives information about its 'authState', which can be: 0=auth needed / 1=authenticated / -1=auth expired / -2=auth invalid/disabled

requestBody.description: request capsule containing the method arguments

post.summary: Creates a subscription for changes which are affecting Visits. On success, a 'SubscriptionUid' will be returned and a call will be made to the given subscriberUrl + '/ConfirmAsSubscriber'. After the subscription has been confirmed, the requested events will be pushed to subscriberUrl + '/NoticeChangedVisits' (NOTICE: the receiving methods also are documented here, because this service itself can act as subscriber)
post.description: Creates a subscription for changes which are affecting Visits. On success, a 'SubscriptionUid' will be returned and a call will be made to the given subscriberUrl + '/ConfirmAsSubscriber'. After the subscription has been confirmed, the requested events will be pushed to subscriberUrl + '/NoticeChangedVisits' (NOTICE: the receiving methods also are documented here, because this service itself can act as subscriber)

requestBody.description: request capsule containing the method arguments

post.summary: Receives notifications about changes which are affecting Visits. IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber! So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously requested from here. The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here, must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!
post.description: Receives notifications about changes which are affecting Visits. IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber! So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously requested from here. The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here, must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!

post.summary: Confirms a Subscription. IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber! So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously requested from here. The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here, must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!
post.description: Confirms a Subscription. IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber! So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously requested from here. The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here, must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!

post.summary: Searches Visits by a given 'filter' (if provided), sorts the results by the given 'sortingField' (if provided) and returns an array of VisitUids for the matching records.

post.summary: Searches Visits which have been modified after(or at) the given 'minTimestampUtc', matching to the given 'filter' (if provided). The result is sorted descenting by the timestamp of the modification (latest first) and will include archived records.

isArchived.description:
This is an internal managed field, which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set when a record is archived. A mapping during data import requires opt-in.

modificationTimestampUtc.description:
This is an internal managed field (UNIX-Timestamp), which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set to the current time when a record is created, updated, archived or unarchived,
but cannot be updated from outside and must not be mapped during data imports.

dataRecordingName.description: unique invariant name of ths task-procedure as defined in the 'StudyWorkflowDefinition' (originated from the sponsor)

taskExecutionTitle.description: title of the task execution as defined in the 'StudyWorkflowDefinition' (originated from the sponsor)

scheduledDateTimeUtc.description: the estimated date when the visit is scheduled *this field is optional

executionDateTimeUtc.description: the real time, when the data was recorded *this field is optional

dataSchemaUrl.description: schema-url of the data which were stored inside of the 'RecordedData' field

notesRegardingOutcome.description: additional notes regarding this dedcated execution (supplied by the execution person) *this field is optional (use null as value)

executingPerson.description: *this field is optional (use null as value)

customFields.description:
Custom fields as defined by the Service.
Call 'GetCustomFieldDescriptors' to get information about supported/required fields.
Any passed values for undefined fields will be ignored.

recordedData.description: RAW data, in the schema as defined at the 'DataSchemaUrl'

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

GetApiVersionRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'GetApiVersion'.
Method: returns the version of the ORSCF specification which is implemented by this API,
(this can be used for backward compatibility within inhomogeneous infrastructures)

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

GetApiVersionResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'GetApiVersion'.
Method: returns the version of the ORSCF specification which is implemented by this API,
(this can be used for backward compatibility within inhomogeneous infrastructures)

GetCapabilitiesRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'GetCapabilities'.
Method: returns a list of API-features (there are several 'services' for different use cases, described by ORSCF)
supported by this implementation. The following values are possible:
'VdrEventSubscription',
'VisitConsume',
'VisitSubmission',
'VisitHL7Export',
'VisitHL7Import',
'DataRecordingSubmission'

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

GetCapabilitiesResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'GetCapabilities'.
Method: returns a list of API-features (there are several 'services' for different use cases, described by ORSCF)
supported by this implementation. The following values are possible:
'VdrEventSubscription',
'VisitConsume',
'VisitSubmission',
'VisitHL7Export',
'VisitHL7Import',
'DataRecordingSubmission'

GetPermittedAuthScopesRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'GetPermittedAuthScopes'.
Method: returns a list of available capabilities ("API:VisitDataConsume") and/or
data-scopes ("Study:9B2C3F48-2941-2F8F-4D35-7D117D5C6F72")
which are permitted for the CURRENT ACCESSOR and gives information about its 'authState', which can be:
0=auth needed /
1=authenticated /
-1=auth expired /
-2=auth invalid/disabled

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

GetPermittedAuthScopesResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'GetPermittedAuthScopes'.
Method: returns a list of available capabilities ("API:VisitDataConsume") and/or
data-scopes ("Study:9B2C3F48-2941-2F8F-4D35-7D117D5C6F72")
which are permitted for the CURRENT ACCESSOR and gives information about its 'authState', which can be:
0=auth needed /
1=authenticated /
-1=auth expired /
-2=auth invalid/disabled

GetOAuthTokenRequestUrlRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'GetOAuthTokenRequestUrl'.
Method: OPTIONAL: If the authentication on the current service is mapped
using tokens and should provide information about the source at this point,
the login URL to be called up via browser (OAuth <see href="https://openid.net/specs/openid-client-initiated-backchannel-authentication-core-1_0.html">'CIBA-Flow'</see>) is returned here.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

Contains results from calling 'GetOAuthTokenRequestUrl'.
Method: OPTIONAL: If the authentication on the current service is mapped
using tokens and should provide information about the source at this point,
the login URL to be called up via browser (OAuth <see href="https://openid.net/specs/openid-client-initiated-backchannel-authentication-core-1_0.html">'CIBA-Flow'</see>) is returned here.

subjectIdentifier.description:
identity of the patient which is usually a pseudonym from a corr. 'IdentiyManagementSystem'
(the exact semantic is defined per study)
*this field has a max length of 100

visitExecutionTitle.description: unique title of the visit execution as defined in the 'StudyWorkflowDefinition' (originated from the sponsor)

customFields.description:
Custom fields as defined by the Service.
Call 'GetCustomFieldDescriptors' to get information about supported/required fields.
Any passed values for undefined fields will be ignored.

subscriberUrl.description: Required Argument for 'SubscribeForChangedVisits' (string): the root-url of the subscriber which needs to provide at least the methods '/ConfirmAsSubscriber' and '/NoticeChangedVisits'

SubscribeForChangedVisitsRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'SubscribeForChangedVisits'.
Method: Creates a subscription for changes which are affecting Visits.
On success, a 'SubscriptionUid' will be returned and a call will be made to the given
subscriberUrl + '/ConfirmAsSubscriber'. After the subscription
has been confirmed, the requested events will be pushed to
subscriberUrl + '/NoticeChangedVisits'
(NOTICE: the receiving methods also are documented here, because this service itself can act as subscriber)

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

SubscribeForChangedVisitsResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'SubscribeForChangedVisits'.
Method: Creates a subscription for changes which are affecting Visits.
On success, a 'SubscriptionUid' will be returned and a call will be made to the given
subscriberUrl + '/ConfirmAsSubscriber'. After the subscription
has been confirmed, the requested events will be pushed to
subscriberUrl + '/NoticeChangedVisits'
(NOTICE: the receiving methods also are documented here, because this service itself can act as subscriber)

subjectIdentifier.description:
identity of the patient which is usually a pseudonym from a corr. 'IdentiyManagementSystem'
(the exact semantic is defined per study)
*this field has a max length of 100

isArchived.description:
This is an internal managed field, which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set when a record is archived. A mapping during data import requires opt-in.

modificationTimestampUtc.description:
This is an internal managed field (UNIX-Timestamp), which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set to the current time when a record is created, updated, archived or unarchived,
but cannot be updated from outside and must not be mapped during data imports.

eventUid.description: Required Argument for 'NoticeChangedVisits' (Guid): a UUID which identifies the current event message

eventSignature.description: Required Argument for 'NoticeChangedVisits' (string): a SHA256 Hash of SubscriptionSecret + EventUid (in lower string representation, without '-' characters!) Sample: SHA256('ThEs3Cr3T'+'c997dfb1c445fea84afe995307713b59') = 'a320ef5b0f563e8dcb16d759961739977afc98b90628d9dc3be519fb20701490'

subscriptionUid.description: Required Argument for 'NoticeChangedVisits' (Guid): a UUID which identifies the subscription for which this event is published

publisherUrl.description: Required Argument for 'NoticeChangedVisits' (string): root-URL of the VDR-Service which is publishing this event

NoticeChangedVisitsRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'NoticeChangedVisits'.
Method: Receives notifications about changes which are affecting Visits.
IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber!
So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously
requested from here.
The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here,
must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!

terminateSubscription.description: Out-Argument of 'NoticeChangedVisits' (bool): an array, which contains one element per changed visit

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

NoticeChangedVisitsResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'NoticeChangedVisits'.
Method: Receives notifications about changes which are affecting Visits.
IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber!
So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously
requested from here.
The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here,
must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!

publisherUrl.description: Required Argument for 'ConfirmAsSubscriber' (string): root-URL of the VDR-Service on which the subscription was requested

subscriptionUid.description: Required Argument for 'ConfirmAsSubscriber' (Guid): the Uid of the subscription which should be confirmed

ConfirmAsSubscriberRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'ConfirmAsSubscriber'.
Method: Confirms a Subscription.
IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber!
So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously
requested from here.
The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here,
must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!

secret.description: Out-Argument of 'ConfirmAsSubscriber' (string): A secret which is generated by the subscriber and used to provide additional security. It will be required for the 'TerminateSubscription' method and it is used to generate SHA256 hashes for signing the delivered event messages. The secret should: have a minimum length of 32 characters. A null or empty string has the semantics that the subscriber refuses to confirm and cancels the subscription setup.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

ConfirmAsSubscriberResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'ConfirmAsSubscriber'.
Method: Confirms a Subscription.
IMPORTANT: this method is dedicated to the usecase, when this service itself acts as a subscriber!
So this can be called by an foreign service during the setup of a subscription, which was previously
requested from here.
The opposite case: any client subscribing to events from here,
must provide its own http endpoint that has such a method!

subscriptionUid.description: Required Argument for 'TerminateSubscription' (Guid): the Uid of the subscription which should be terminated

secret.description: Required Argument for 'TerminateSubscription' (string): the (same) secret, which was given by the subscriber during the subscription setup

TerminateSubscriptionRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'TerminateSubscription'.
Method: Terminates a subscription (on publisher side) and returns a boolean,
which indicates success.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

TerminateSubscriptionResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'TerminateSubscription'.
Method: Terminates a subscription (on publisher side) and returns a boolean,
which indicates success.

secret.description: Required Argument for 'GetSubsriptionsBySubscriberUrl' (string): the (same) secret, which was given by the subscriber during the subscription setup

GetSubsriptionsBySubscriberUrlRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'GetSubsriptionsBySubscriberUrl'.
Method: Returns an array of subscriptionUid's.
This method helps subscribers to evaluate whether current subscriptions are still active.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

GetSubsriptionsBySubscriberUrlResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'GetSubsriptionsBySubscriberUrl'.
Method: Returns an array of subscriptionUid's.
This method helps subscribers to evaluate whether current subscriptions are still active.

sortingField.description: Optional Argument for 'SearchVisits' (string): A fieldname, which should be used to sort the result (can also be a 'CustomField'). If not provided, the result will be sorted by the creation date of the records

sortDescending.description: Optional Argument for 'SearchVisits' (bool?): toggles the sorting direction

includeArchivedRecords.description: Optional Argument for 'SearchVisits' (bool?): includes archived records in the result

limitResults.description: Optional Argument for 'SearchVisits' (Int32?): a value greather than zero will represent a maximum count of results, that sould be returned

SearchVisitsRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'SearchVisits'.
Method: Searches Visits by a given 'filter' (if provided),
sorts the results by the given 'sortingField' (if provided) and
returns an array of VisitUids for the matching records.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

SearchVisitsResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'SearchVisits'.
Method: Searches Visits by a given 'filter' (if provided),
sorts the results by the given 'sortingField' (if provided) and
returns an array of VisitUids for the matching records.

minTimestampUtc.description: Required Argument for 'SearchChangedVisits' (Int64): start of the timespan to search (as UNIX-Timestamp)

SearchChangedVisitsRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'SearchChangedVisits'.
Method: Searches Visits which have been modified after(or at) the given 'minTimestampUtc',
matching to the given 'filter' (if provided).
The result is sorted descenting by the timestamp of the modification (latest first) and will
include archived records.

latestTimestampUtc.description: Out-Argument of 'SearchChangedVisits' (Int64): the exact timestamp of the search (as UNIX-Timestamp)

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

SearchChangedVisitsResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'SearchChangedVisits'.
Method: Searches Visits which have been modified after(or at) the given 'minTimestampUtc',
matching to the given 'filter' (if provided).
The result is sorted descenting by the timestamp of the modification (latest first) and will
include archived records.

languagePref.description: Optional Argument for 'GetCustomFieldDescriptorsForVisit' (string): Preferred language for the 'DisplayLabel' and 'InputDescription' fields of the returned descriptors. The default is 'EN'.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

CheckVisitExisitenceRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'CheckVisitExisitence'.
Method: Checks the existence of 'Visits' for a given list of visitUids

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

CheckVisitExisitenceResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'CheckVisitExisitence'.
Method: Checks the existence of 'Visits' for a given list of visitUids

GetVisitFieldsRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'GetVisitFields'.
Method: loads the requested visits and returns lightweight json objects (without childs),
which are optimized to be displayed as table (the most common UI use case).
This models containig a combination of:
essential fieds from the record,
calculated fields (numbers of child records),
custom fields (choosen by the service)

subjectIdentifier.description:
identity of the patient which is usually a pseudonym from a corr. 'IdentiyManagementSystem'
(the exact semantic is defined per study)
*this field has a max length of 100

isArchived.description:
This is an internal managed field, which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set when a record is archived. A mapping during data import requires opt-in.

modificationTimestampUtc.description:
This is an internal managed field (UNIX-Timestamp), which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set to the current time when a record is created, updated, archived or unarchived,
but cannot be updated from outside and must not be mapped during data imports.

visitExecutionTitle.description: unique title of the visit execution as defined in the 'StudyWorkflowDefinition' (originated from the sponsor)

scheduledDateUtc.description: the estimated date when the visit is scheduled for execution *this field is optional

executionDateUtc.description: the real date, when the visits was executed *this field is optional

executingPerson.description: *this field is optional (use null as value)

customFields.description:
Custom fields as defined by the Service.
Call 'GetCustomFieldDescriptors' to get information about supported/required fields.
Any passed values for undefined fields will be ignored.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

This models containig a combination of:

ExportVisitFhirRessourcesRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'ExportVisitFhirRessources'.
Method: Exports a structure containing HL7/FHIR-Ressources (JSON only) and
the essential fields which are required to qualify a ORSCF record.

subjectIdentifier.description:
identity of the patient which is usually a pseudonym from a corr. 'IdentiyManagementSystem'
(the exact semantic is defined per study)
*this field has a max length of 100

isArchived.description:
This is an internal managed field, which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set when a record is archived. A mapping during data import requires opt-in.

modificationTimestampUtc.description:
This is an internal managed field (UNIX-Timestamp), which is related to the state of records dedicated to the database.
It will be automatically set to the current time when a record is created, updated, archived or unarchived,
but cannot be updated from outside and must not be mapped during data imports.

appointmentRessource.description: a HL7 <see href="http://www.hl7.org/fhir/appointment.html">'Appointment'</see> resource in json format

VisitFhirRessourceContainer.description:
A structure containing HL7/FHIR-Ressources (JSON only) and
the essential fields which are required to qualify a ORSCF record.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

ExportVisitFhirRessourcesResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'ExportVisitFhirRessources'.
Method: Exports a structure containing HL7/FHIR-Ressources (JSON only) and
the essential fields which are required to qualify a ORSCF record.

visitFhirRessources.description: Required Argument for 'ImportVisitFhirRessources' (VisitFhirRessourceContainer[]): A structure containing HL7/FHIR-Ressources (JSON only) and the essential fields which are required to qualify a ORSCF record.

ImportVisitFhirRessourcesRequest.description:
Contains arguments for calling 'ImportVisitFhirRessources'.
Method: Exports a structure containing HL7/FHIR-Ressources (JSON only) and
the essential fields which are required to qualify a ORSCF record.

fault.description: This field contains error text equivalent to an Exception message! (note that only 'fault' XOR 'return' can have a value != null)

ImportVisitFhirRessourcesResponse.description:
Contains results from calling 'ImportVisitFhirRessources'.
Method: Exports a structure containing HL7/FHIR-Ressources (JSON only) and
the essential fields which are required to qualify a ORSCF record.

archivedVisitUids.description: Out-Argument of 'ArchiveVisits' (Guid[]): also including the Uids of already archived records

visitProdecureName.description: unique invariant name of the visit-procedure as defined in the 'StudyWorkflowDefinition' (originated from the sponsor)

visitExecutionTitle.description: unique title of the visit execution as defined in the 'StudyWorkflowDefinition' (originated from the sponsor)

executingPerson.description: *this field is optional (use null as value)

customFields.description:
Custom fields as defined by the Service.
Call 'GetCustomFieldDescriptors' to get information about supported/required fields.
Any passed values for undefined fields will be ignored.

scheduledDateUtc.description: the estimated date when the visit is scheduled for execution *this field is optional

executionDateUtc.description: the real date, when the visits was executed *this field is optional
